meanings.definition: An official order or commission to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's mandate was to assign homework every day.
meanings.sent2: The president issued a mandate for all citizens to wear masks in public.
meanings.sent3: The cat's mandate to catch the mouse was met with laziness.
meanings.sent4: The mandate from the boss hung over the employees like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The king's mandate to build a grand palace was carried out with great enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: The authority to carry out a policy or course of action.
meanings.sent1: With full mandate from the board, the CEO implemented new company policies.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had the mandate to arrest anyone causing a disturbance.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to think he had the mandate to decide when it was time for a walk.
meanings.sent4: The mandate of the captain on the ship was unquestionable.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's mandate to protect the city made him a beloved figure among the citizens.

meanings.sent1: The coach's mandate to the team was to give their best effort in every game.
meanings.sent2: The company's mandate to its employees was to prioritize customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's mandate to his stuffed animals was to have a tea party every afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The mandate from the principal to the students was to maintain a clean and tidy school environment.
meanings.sent5: The general's mandate to his troops was to hold their position at all costs.
